page.title: 12POOL-THE EXCAVATION
page.content: During the summer of{1983}a team of {archaeologists}from the{University of {Bradford}dug trial trenches to find the site of the settlement. When they uncovered the area, they exposed a complex of buildings, which were extremely well preserved. The buildings consisted of{six}individual {house-like areas,}all conected through a labyrinth of{passage-ways}and {chambers. Doorways, steps, hearths}and a{floor}were found still{intact,}which gave great insight into{Iron Age {architecture and living conditions.}A very significant find, which was made in the summer of 1984, was what is known as the{Ogam Stone.}It is a stone which was inscribed with letters of the Ogam alphabet,which was thought to have originated in the{fourth century {A.D.
